alert.note: Alert for Central Somerset; Northern Franklin; Southern Franklin; Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 7:46PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Somerset County through 830 PM EDT... At 746 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bingham, or 16 miles northwest of Skowhegan, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pittsfield, Skowhegan, Madison, Bingham, Anson, Canaan, Hartland, Cornville, Athens, Embden, Harmony, Detroit, Brighton Plantation, Solon, Palmyra, Moscow, Lexington, Concord, Mayfield and Saint Albans. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 151 and 156. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for western and west central Maine.

area.areaDesc: Central Somerset; Northern Franklin; Southern Franklin; Southern Somerset
